item.title: Report X-2024081881
item.description:
Report X-2024081881

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the loading process at the MEMH location a fiberboard box fell off the belt and was ran over by a dolly. All the containers inside were crushed releasing the contents inside of the fiberboard box. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024081800
item.description:
Report X-2024081800

  • City: NASHVILLE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Hazmat, undeclared. No DOT labels or markings on leaking box. 53lb HART HW80544 Pressure Washer lost 16oz of gasoline and at least 6oz of oil from tanks that were not drained prior to shipping. Entered as UN3363, Dangerous Goods in Machinery, 9.

item.title: Report X-2024081877
item.description:
Report X-2024081877

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. The outer box was significantly wet and damaged. Inner contents: 4 plastic bottles x 3.785 Liters of Trans Chem Muriatic Acid. One plastic bottle leaked because of a loose/detatched top. All remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending FAA investigation,

item.title: Report X-2024081761
item.description:
Report X-2024081761

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Railroad employee observed fresh liquid on the exterior of UTLX 662597 while switching the track. Car was isolated and a response contractor was called to investigate and repair the car. Contractor mounted the car and observed the manway nozzle gasket protruding unusually from the seat of the manway lid. Contractor opened the manway and noted the nozzle gasket was deteriorated and misaligned on the nozzle causing the release. A new nozzle gasket was installed and the manway was properly secured.

item.title: Report I-2024080087
item.description:
Report I-2024080087

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: Memphis
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Flight Attendants first noticed an electrical burning smell around row 34-36 on the aircraft. Customer in 36D with an unknown brand of vape reported to the Flight Attendants that his vape was getting extremely hot to the touch. Flight Attendants placed the vape in a fire containment bag with some water. The flight landed shortly thereafter in MEM and the fire containment bag was handed over to ARFF by the Flight Attendants.

item.title: Report X-2024081275
item.description:
Report X-2024081275

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill & Exposure. Hazmat. Leaking box, loss of 0.5 gal from 4x1gal plastic bottles Ecolab 6118111 Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid. Package Handler Essi Akota's leg was exposed and she felt a burning sensation while unloading. No further reaction to corrosive. Improper load orientation of the box on the bottom of wall in trailer FEDZ 557696 was noted; safety seals below caps corroded. 2 other boxes impacted by spill: TRK 278369646929 and 278010916733. Please see attached scan of Hazmat Incident Form completed at time of incident.
